title: I'm a mere child, but I have a strong fear of death. I learned that when Yellowstone erupts, any second now considering it's overdue, it will wipe all of us out. How do I dampen my fear? - Quora

response.answer_text: Answered 20 January, 2020 My daughter drew this when she was four. She described it as: “Yellowstone blowing up and me being real sad.” I was happy to reassure her it’s not going to happen within weeks or hours as seen on television.  Jesse Lee O’Connor 李杰西's answer to Is Yellowstone Caldera really as dangerous as it is in movies? I’m so very sorry that people have put in your head that a super-eruption of the Yellowstone hot spot is overdue. While none of us can be absolutely certain of natural disasters, I wish to assure you that no real scientists believe it’s either overdue nor that it could happen any day, let alone any second. It’s also a shame that well-meaning other answerers only concentrated on our powerlessness and the greater likelihood of other means of death than from Yellowstone. But science is a tool you can count on for understanding which is more powerful than fear There’s a big area underneath Yellowstone that nervous people will tell you is packed full of melted rock just straining to burst upwards and ruin the whole world. This is not true. How big is the magma chamber under Yellowstone? It has 4,000 [cu.] km (960 cu mi) underground volume, of which [only] 6–8% is filled with molten rock Yellowstone Caldera - Wikipedia Its simply not ready to erupt, even if you tunneled down to it or dropped the biggest bomb ever on it or even a space rock. (An asteroid impact would be more destructive than a super eruption.) Before a large eruption is possible, it would need decades, 20, 30, 40 or more years of changes they can measure and see what’s happening before there’s any danger of that. Why you can stop worrying Yellowstone's supervolcano is about to end the world I’m very sorry that bad people, for motivations unknown, have stirred up so many with rumours and falsehoods not supported by real-world physics and evidence. Real science is what you can measure, what you can repeat and what you can maybe disprove. Spreading fear without evidence is nothing more than gossip. It is unethical to go into a crowded theater and yell “fire.” The doom mongers either have poor math skills or no regard for reason but only wish to spread malcontent. They say, “Yellowstone has erupted every 600,000 years. It’s been 631,000 since the last one. It’s overdue!” Please count with me: 2,100,000 years minus 1,300,000 years equals 800,000 years1,300,000 minus 631,000 equals 669,000 yearsThey can’t count the third interval as 631,000 years because it’s not erupting now and it can’t erupt to form a caldera for decades, most say not for thousands of years from now. (A small eruption that wouldn’t hurt the planet could happen sooner.)Here’s the easiest math: 2,100,000 divided by 3 equals 700,000 average years between the last three big eruptions and that only works if it’s erupting right now. Go back further in time: 13 big, caldera-forming eruptions in 16,500,000 years yields an average of 1,269,231 years between them, if it goes off now.  Jesse Lee O’Connor 李杰西's answer to What will really happen when the Yellowstone supervolcano erupts? Watch my lips: It Is NOT Over Due. Jesse Lee O’Connor 李杰西's answer to Realistically, when will the Super Volcano at Yellowstone explode? Is there a warning before it happens? Shame on the peddlers of fear and anxiety for vexing our youth.  20 Amazing Wildlife Photos in Yellowstone National Park Come see Yellowstone! It’s not the end of the world. ™ “Sufficient to the day is its own trouble.”

There are so many ways death could come, but I will tell you a secret. The things we worry about are seldom the events that occur. You might be obsessing about Yellowstone, but meanwhile there’s a troubling flu of some sort unfolding in China that could become a plague. And apparently being hit with a giant asteroid is much likelier than I ever realized. Truthfully, you stand a better chance of being hit by a random drunk driver than going by any of these means. So. You have to get ahold of yourself and control what you can, such as getting an annual flu shot, and then you have to go about your business. Spending your life worrying over what you can’t control will make you and those around you unhappy and will impede your delight in living your one wild and precious life. Cast aside your fears and live with passion and daring. Have fun every day you’re privileged to walk on this planet. Think of ways to help others so you keep your mind off of yourself. Exercise every day. Eat healthy foods, no junk. Forget about Yellowstone, about which you can do nothing. Defend someone from a bully. Help an old lady cross a street. Be the amazing person you already are. love and luck ❤️🍀
